abstract: The documentary filmmaker Frederick Wiseman discusses his craft and his film "Crazy Horse."
snippet: The documentary filmmaker Frederick Wiseman discusses his craft and his film "Crazy Horse."
lead_paragraph: From high schools, to state legislatures to boxing gyms, the documentary filmmaker Frederick Wiseman has been exploring the institutions that make the world tick. For his latest film, "Crazy Horse," the director takes a look inside the workings of a landmark French strip club that has been operating since 1951. In his survey of documentaries at the New York Film Festival, A. O. Scott called the film "a study of artistic process that is itself a work of art, and, as such, a reminder of what a documentary can be." Here, Mr. Wiseman discusses what interests him in the process of making documentaries and what he hopes to convey to his audience.
